reviews.text: Marixsa is the best! My little guy attended Tambor for 6 months and got to the point where he would skip ahead of us and shut the door in our faces when he got there - he couldn't wait to play with his friends! She's attentive, creative, knows when to be hands-on and when to encourage independence. We love and trust her completely.

reviews.name: Nicole
reviews.text: Marixsa leads Tambor with an incredible energy. She seems to know the perfect way to engage each child and help that child learn and grow. She is a gem and has created a fantastic program. Tambor is fun, interesting,and educational, and I'm so thrilled that our little one is part of it.

reviews.name: Meghan
reviews.text: We are so lucky we found Tambor! Our little guy loved his time there this past spring (2018). And no wonder.... Marixsa has a warm, mama bear energy with a true gift for early childhood education. Her home is super kid-focused and filled with art, music and lots of play! We've just loved everything about our experience with Marixsa - highly recommend!!

reviews.name: Nobella
reviews.text: Marixsa is an awesome educator! She puts thought and care into each lesson plan. She connects with each child and has a special way of encouraging then to function as individuals. I highly recommend her classes for your little one!

reviews.name: Abby
reviews.text: Marixsa has a wonderful thing going on at her home-based Spanish Immersion playgroup. My 4-year old has been attending Tambor this year, and he has such a fun time with Marixsa and the kids in the group. We do not speak or teach Spanish at home, but when he goes to Marixsa's, he easily slides into the routine of Spanish. Her home is set up in such a child-friendly way, she makes food for the kids, and she works diligently to plan music, art, and physical activities that are age appropriate. Marixsa is also extremely trustworthy and responsible - she takes this job seriously and is a mom of 3. It's so clear that she is meant to be in early childhood education! Her warmth and her demeanor and patience make for a wonderful teacher. All of these wonderful things at a very reasonable price make this little playgroup a gem!

reviews.name: Susannah
reviews.text: My daughter loved her time with Marixsa. My husband’s family is Venezuelan, and we want to raise our daughter bilingual, but I don’t speak Spanish, and I’m the one who spends most of the day with her. Enter Marixsa! Her warmth made my little one comfortable right away, and her creativity and sense of wonder kept her captivated all day. Instruments! Books! Exploring in the back garden! I highly recommend Marixsa’s program.

reviews.name: Marie
reviews.text: Marixsa is an authentically warm, nurturing, earthmother-like person. Children feel very comfortable in her presence. She's committed to building community and using education to do it.

reviews.name: Natalia
reviews.text: My two boys, ages 3 and almost 5 had a wonderful time at Marixsa's summer camp! We recently relocated to Brooklyn after living in Cusco, Peru and we had been looking for a school that resembled my waldorf/montessori inspired preschool over there, that my son loved. And we found it with Marixsa! A nurturing, creative and child centered discovery space with outdoors time to play with the earth and the water and in Spanish!! Our dream came true this summer and my boys would wake up every morning excited to go to the Taino school (that is how we named it)! Marixsa brings together her soul and love for the ways she believes her own children should learn, her roots and her professional teaching knowledge in the perfect inspiring way.

reviews.name: Jessica
reviews.text: My son had the fortunate experience of taking part in Marixsa's Spanish summer camp the very first summer she opened her home. Each day was filled with playful learning that was responsive to each child's needs. They spent lots meaningful time outdoors, learning in constructive ways. I highly recommend Marixsa as a director, teacher and overall amazing person. You will not be disappointed if you choose to send your child to her program.

reviews.name: Ourania
reviews.text: I experience Mrs. Marixsa with her own and other children every day for the last year. As a certified Waldorf teacher and a mother myself, it is such a pleasing experience to witness her professionalism and art inner devotion during the interaction with children. She is guiding the children firmly, always with respect and warmth. There is always a positive and secure atmosphere within the groups, where elder children (up to 10years) show smaller children what they have discovered (f.i.). She gives children the space to develop socially, emotionally and at the same time manages amazingly that children of different age groups can be harmoniously together and/or explore age appropriately on their own. I know, my daughter (4yrs.) loves Mrs. Marixsa and her classes.

reviews.name: Eisa
reviews.text: I am happy to recommend Marixsa Rodriguez and her home-based summer program. I am the Founder and Director of Camp Fort Greene and a former classroom teacher with a master's degree from Teachers College, Columbia University. I have known Marixsa for 8 years, as our sons have grown up together here in Brooklyn. I first met Marixsa at the Clinton Hill Library, where we attended Mommy and Me classes led by a local librarian. Back then we joined forces with another mom who also has a master's degree in education, and the three of us developed a co-op program for our toddlers to experience rich opportunities for social, emotional, and cognitive development. We wanted to prepare our little ones for big kid school, so we added in circle time and clean-up time, and we wanted to provide age-appropriate activities, so we built in one simple craft project, time for singing with simple instruments, a story, and free play. We found a location in Bedford Stuyvesant and enjoyed a fun year together. While this once a week co-op program was taking place, we continued to get together in each other's homes for play-dates. Marixsa always contributed fun, age-appropriate craft activities, music, and Spanish language and culture to our experiences. She is gifted in her ability to design and make clothes, bags, and decorative items for children and adults, and she makes great use of found materials; Marixsa brings this talent to her work with children, encouraging them to design and make beautiful objects that are often also useful. She understands the importance of gentle music in little ones' lives, and her ability to sing while playing with percussive instruments designed for young people encourages their own inner musicianship and develops counting skills. She is bi-lingual, so she does more than count to ten in Spanish with children. Marixsa feels very strongly that young people learning the language should be able to talk about their use of a magnifying glass or the way a bird spreads its wings in Spanish. While she recognizes the value of basic conversational language learning, she provides opportunities for children to really develop a stronger Spanish language proficiency across the curriculum in areas like science and math. A dedicated learner herself, Marixsa studied scholarly books on Waldorf and Montessori. Over the years, she has never lost the opportunity to take advantage of a learning moment while encouraging fun and creativity. For example, instead of hiring a clown or magician for her son's birthdays, Marixsa would work with him to come up with a theme, make decorations for their home, and prepare fun activities for the birthday boy and all his guests to share together. Marixsa has a terrific affinity for the natural world and has developed that love in her own New York City children. They garden, compost, and explore all the wild wonders in our urban habitat. In her light-filled, warm, welcoming home, you will find intentional and natural objects in place to encourage age-appropriate explorations. She is a bright, beautiful, kind person who cares deeply about children. I recommend her and her program with great enthusiasm.

reviews.name: Liz
reviews.text: Marixsa is an open hearted, loving, creative, mother and amazing with children!!! If I still lived in Brooklyn (We moved to Canada.) I would definately send my daughter to Marixsa's Camp. Two years ago, we formed a Daycare Co-op at Marixsa's home with six children and Marixsa generously provided her home and even though we hired a child care worker, Marixsa was always doing creative projects and volunteering her time with the children. Marixsa is fully bilingual and my daughter now speaks some Spanish. Marixsa's children are amazing and my daughter became close to Taina and the girls have a bond forever. I am super picky about who I leave my children with in terms of a loving safe space but Marixsa is one of the best! Marixsa would never punish a child or treat them in any way except love and respect. Any family would be lucky to know Marixsa and her family!

job.title: Prop Master in TV and Film
Vice President
job.employer: New York Center for Child Development

name: Julia
blurb: I work for the city, am married to another city employee, and we are about to have our second kid. We’ve lived in the neighborhood for about 3 years and in Brooklyn for about 7.

name: Marie
blurb: I’m a preschool teacher, costume designer, actor, writer, and artist. I’m a new parent and I’m doing it by myself! Also a huge cat lover.

name: Eileen
blurb: I am the director of operations at a digital marketing agency and I run a non-profit. I have two sweet boys who are full of energy. We love playgrounds, libraries, and exploring.

name: Holmes
blurb: I'm an activist, a step dad, and now I run a startup, I've been babysitting since I was 11.

children.name: Martina
children.allergies: Martina is mildly allergic to gluten
children.otherNotes: Please try to limit Martina's screentime.

reviews.text: Holmes takes great care of kids!

concerns.text: Holmes's neighbors have a big scary dog so kids should probably stay inside.
